channel.title: What phone to buy?
channel.description:
So recently I was promised that I would buy a new phone and that it can be anything I want. Suggestions anybody? I'm looking for a phone that won't make me cringe every time i take it out in public, and for one that has a decent battery life. Sound output should be decent as well. Camera is not a huge factor imo, but it would be a nice bonus if it had a good camera too. Also it should be compatible with those mp3 headphones, w/e they're called.
Suggest pls.

item.title: What phone to buy?
item.dc:creator: @Reaper114 Reaper114
item.description:
@Reaper114 wrote:

I was in the exact same situation a few months ago and an HTC Evo 4g from sprint isn’t to bad… I ended up getting one. I think sprints coverage needs to step it up a bit but definately check out some HTC phones. They have a different phone for almost every carrier and they’re most or all 4g. Just find a plan that you get the most of you money and keep in mind what phones look good to you. If you find one you like, watch a review and find the phones pros and cons, every phone has em…just try to find the one that you’ll adjust to the most.

BTW… The EVO 4g is reasonably cheap but it has enough of the good stuff. 8Mp rear camera with dual LED flash and 1.3mp front camera for qik video chats.
Android OS and if your looking for a BIG screen, the evolution will meet your needs with a 4.3 inch screen that broadcasts in 720p and 480p Res.

Great interface but would take some getting used to if you are currently using and iPod touch or something its going to feel mammoth for a while but it has some pretty nice things that make it worth while. If I was you I’d definatly take a look at one.

Don’t forget to post you decision here!

Read full topic

item.title: What phone to buy?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:7, topic:402947”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=500008.msg3656878#msg3656878 date=1310084813]
http://www.mobile-phones-uk.org.uk/samsung-galaxy-s2.htm
[/quote]
That looks awesome. Only deterrent might be the price, but I was kind of confused by the best deals thing. Does this mean that the best price I can get was the $500 one?

EDIT: oh it’s 500 euros…[/quote]

Well, it probably wouldn’t be that price, depending on if you’re with a contract based company who offers upgrades (of which you’re eligible for) you could receive a reasonable discount.

Read full topic
